form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Marshall (for himself, Mr. Tuberville, Mr. Ricketts, and Mr. Justice) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish a deduction for certain overtime payments.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Overtime Wages Tax Relief Act.

paragraph.text: Part VII of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating section 224 as section 225 and by inserting after section 223 the following new section:

subsection.text: There shall be allowed as a deduction an amount equal to so much of any overtime compensation received by an individual as does not exceed $10,000 ($20,000 in the case of a joint return) for the taxable year.

The amount of the deduction allowable under subsection (a) shall be reduced (but not below zero) by $50 for each $1,000 (or fraction thereof) by which the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income exceeds $100,000 ($200,000 in the case of a joint return). For purposes of the preceding sentence, the term modified adjusted gross income means adjusted gross income increased by any amount excluded from gross income under section 911, 931, or 933.
For purposes of this section, the term overtime compensation means compensation that is paid to a taxpayer—

paragraph.text: at a rate of not less than one and one-half times the regular rate at which the taxpayer is employed, and
for work for a single employer that is in excess of a maximum number of hours of such work for a specified period of time as required pursuant to—

subparagraph.text: section 7 of the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938, or

clause.text: is a collective bargaining agreement or an agreement or understanding arrived at between the employer and the employee before performance of the work, and
provides that such maximum number of hours for a specified period of time is not less than 40 hours for a 7-day work period.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall provide such regulations or other guidance as may be necessary to carry out this section.

subsection.text: Section 6051(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking and at the end of paragraph (16), by striking the period at the end of paragraph (17) and inserting , and, and by inserting after paragraph (17) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: the total amount of overtime compensation as defined in section 224(b).

subsection.text: The Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretary's delegate) shall modify the tables and procedures prescribed under section 3402(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to take into account the deduction allowed under section 224 of such Code (as added by this Act).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
